de.esoco.gwt.shared

Interface AuthenticatedService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CommandService, com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.RemoteService
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    GwtApplicationService, ProcessService, StorageService
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AuthenticatedServiceImpl, GwtApplicationServiceImpl, ProcessServiceImpl, StorageServiceImpl

    public interface AuthenticatedService
extends CommandService
    A standard interface for services that require a user to authenticate before service methods can be executed.

      • LOGIN

        static final Command<de.esoco.data.element.StringDataElement,de.esoco.data.element.DataElementList> LOGIN
        This command performs a login. The argument is a string data element with the login name as it's name and the password as the value. If the call is an attempt to re-login an expired session the data element may contain a property with the name SESSION_ID that contains the previous session ID (typically stored by the client in a cookie) to re-use the data from the expired session. In that case the returned data will contain a new session ID which must again be stored by the client.

        On successful authentication the result is a DataElementList containing user-specific data. The base implementation will add the user name string in an element with the name LOGIN_NAME. Subclasses may add additional user data elements.

      • GET_USER_DATA

        static final Command<de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?>,de.esoco.data.element.DataElementList> GET_USER_DATA
        This command returns the data of the user that is currently logged in as described for the LOGIN command. If the user is not logged in an AuthenticationException will be thrown. No input value is required and it should be NULL.

      • LOGOUT

        static final Command<de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?>,de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?>> LOGOUT
        This command performs a log out of the current user. If no user is logged in it will have no effect. No input value is required and it should be NULL. This is a VOID call, i.e. the returned value is always NULL.

      • CHANGE_PASSWORD

        static final Command<de.esoco.data.element.StringDataElement,de.esoco.data.element.DataElement<?>> CHANGE_PASSWORD
        A command to change the password of the currently authenticated user. The input data element must contain the old password as it's name and the new password as it's value.
